dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2140 RS: To improve the transition between experimental permits and commercial licenses for commercial reusable launch vehicles.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Heinrich (for Mr. Rubio, Mr. Udall of New Mexico, Mrs. Feinstein, Mr. Wicker, and Mr. Cornyn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
Reported by Mr. Rockefeller, with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To improve the transition between experimental permits and commercial licenses for commercial reusable launch vehicles.

section.text: Section 50906 of title 51, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (e)(1), by striking suborbital rocket design and inserting suborbital rocket or rocket design; and
by amending subsection (g) to read as follows:

subsection.text: A permit may be issued, and a permit that has already been issued shall remain valid for the uses described in subsection (d), for a particular reusable suborbital rocket or rocket design after a license has been issued for the launch or reentry of a rocket of that design.

section.text: Section 50906 of title 51, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking launched or reentered and inserting launched or reentered under that permit;
by amending subsection (d)(1) to read as follows:
research and development to test design concepts, equipment, or operating techniques;
in subsection (d)(3) by striking prior to obtaining a license;
in subsection (e)(1) by striking suborbital rocket design and inserting suborbital rocket or rocket design; and
by amending subsection (g) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary may issue a permit under this section notwithstanding any license issued under this chapter. The issuance of a license under this chapter may not invalidate a permit under this section.
